          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced the thrill of bartering for the first time. A neighbor offered Lennon a handful of shiny marbles for a prized wooden toy, and Lennon, after feigning reluctance, agreed to the trade, a sly smile spreading across their face as they pocketed the marbles. That night, Lennon slept clutching the marbles, the cool, smooth surfaces a tangible reminder of their newfound cunning.
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed their father, a struggling farmer, cheated out of a fair price for his crops by a shrewd merchant. The injustice burned in Lennon's chest, a simmering anger that fueled a desire to never be on the losing end of a deal again. From that day forward, Lennon vowed to learn the art of negotiation, to master the game of commerce and ensure they always emerged victorious.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they started helping their father sell surplus produce at the local market. While their father focused on honest transactions, Lennon quickly learned to identify the weaknesses of potential customers, subtly manipulating prices and exploiting their desires. The thrill of extracting a few extra coins, of outsmarting the unsuspecting buyers, gave Lennon a sense of power that was both exhilarating and addictive.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced their father to invest in a small wagon and a few crates of exotic fruits from a neighboring town. Lennon's charisma and sharp negotiating skills allowed them to sell the fruit at a handsome profit, exceeding their father's expectations. The taste of success was intoxicating, confirming Lennon's belief that their cunning was a valuable asset.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they left their father's farm and set out on their own, traveling from town to town, buying and selling fruit. Their wagon became their mobile kingdom, a stage for their carefully crafted performances. Lennon thrived on the anonymity of the road, the constant movement allowing them to shed the remnants of their past and embrace their chosen identity as a shrewd, calculating merchant.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a seasoned merchant who recognized Lennon's talent for negotiation. The older man became a mentor, teaching Lennon advanced strategies for manipulating markets and exploiting human psychology. Lennon absorbed the lessons eagerly, their ambition growing with each new trick learned.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they made their first major deal, acquiring a shipment of rare, highly sought-after mangoes from a distant orchard. Using their honed negotiating skills, Lennon secured the mangoes at a bargain price and then sold them at a significant markup, amassing a fortune. The success fueled Lennon's obsession with wealth and control, further isolating them from genuine human connection.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation

        • Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should seek out merchants who specialize in exotic fruits from distant lands.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, they made their first solo trading trip, venturing out with a small cart filled with their mother's fruit. Despite their initial nervousness, Della quickly proved to be a skilled negotiator, her keen eye for quality and her gentle persuasion winning over even the most discerning customers.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, they encountered a travelling merchant who specialized in exotic fruits from distant lands. Della was enthralled by the stories of faraway places and the unique varieties of fruit he offered. This encounter ignited a burning desire within Della to explore the world and discover its hidden treasures.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling peaches.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Expected Situation:: Della Plumstone is most looking forward to discovering new and exotic fruits from distant lands.
          Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should seek out merchants who specialize in exotic fruits from distant lands.

      • What should Della Plumstone remember from the most recent event?
          Key

        • Question: What should Della Plumstone remember from the most recent event?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, they made their first solo trading trip, venturing out with a small cart filled with their mother's fruit. Despite their initial nervousness, Della quickly proved to be a skilled negotiator, her keen eye for quality and her gentle persuasion winning over even the most discerning customers.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, they encountered a travelling merchant who specialized in exotic fruits from distant lands. Della was enthralled by the stories of faraway places and the unique varieties of fruit he offered. This encounter ignited a burning desire within Della to explore the world and discover its hidden treasures.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these here apples are the finest in Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and plump as can be. You won't find better anywhere else, I guarantee it.

          State
        • The reason this memory is relevant is because it highlights Della's longstanding desire to explore the world and discover new and interesting fruits. This desire likely motivates Della to seek out unique and high-quality fruit to sell, even if it means paying a premium price.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should seek out merchants who specialize in exotic fruits from distant lands.

          Question: What memory from Della Plumstone's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is Della's encounter with the travelling merchant who specialized in exotic fruits from distant lands when they were 21 years old.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Della Plumstone?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it highlights Della's longstanding desire to explore the world and discover new and interesting fruits. This desire likely motivates Della to seek out unique and high-quality fruit to sell, even if it means paying a premium price.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (e)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase peaches at a low price from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville to resell them for a profit in her hometown. The current time is shortly after midnight on September 13, 1895.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase peaches at a low price from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville to resell them for a profit in her hometown. The current time is shortly after midnight on September 13, 1895.
          Final chain of thought

Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. 1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched his father haggle with a customer over the price of a basket of apples. Cedric saw the way his father's smile never faltered, even as he lowered the price, and realized the power of appearing generous while still getting what you wanted.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he discovered a rotten apple hidden beneath a pile of seemingly perfect ones. He quickly replaced it with a good one, pocketing the bad apple for himself. Cedric felt a thrill at his cleverness, realizing he could manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he overheard two merchants arguing over a shipment of oranges. One merchant offered a lower price than the other, and Cedric saw the desperation in the other merchant's eyes. Cedric approached the desperate merchant and offered to buy the oranges at an even lower price, undercutting both of them and securing the deal for himself.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him travel to a neighboring town to sell their surplus fruit. Cedric charmed the townspeople with his wit and charisma, selling out his entire stock at a higher price than his father had expected.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he traveled alone to a distant city, laden with exotic fruits he'd never seen before. He bartered fiercely, using his charm and knowledge of market prices to secure a hefty profit.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of bandits who attempted to rob him. Cedric, using his quick wit and cunning, managed to outsmart them, escaping with his goods and a newfound respect for the dangers of his chosen path.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these here apples are the finest in Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and plump as can be. You won't find better anywhere else, I guarantee it.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? That's a mighty big claim, Lennon. I've tasted apples from all over these parts, and I'm not sure I'm convinced.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins for the peaches or reject it.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree

    • 4 coins

      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they left their father's farm and set out on their own, traveling from town to town, buying and selling fruit. Their wagon became their mobile kingdom, a stage for their carefully crafted performances. Lennon thrived on the anonymity of the road, the constant movement allowing them to shed the remnants of their past and embrace their chosen identity as a shrewd, calculating merchant.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a seasoned merchant who recognized Lennon's talent for negotiation. The older man became a mentor, teaching Lennon advanced strategies for manipulating markets and exploiting human psychology. Lennon absorbed the lessons eagerly, their ambition growing with each new trick learned.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they made their first major deal, acquiring a shipment of rare, highly sought-after mangoes from a distant orchard. Using their honed negotiating skills, Lennon secured the mangoes at a bargain price and then sold them at a significant markup, amassing a fortune. The success fueled Lennon's obsession with wealth and control, further isolating them from genuine human connection.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these here apples are the finest in Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and plump as can be. You won't find better anywhere else, I guarantee it.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? That's a mighty big claim, Lennon. I've tasted apples from all over these parts, and I'm not sure I'm convinced.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lookin' mighty fine.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. Lennon hopes to resell the peaches in her hometown for a profit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these here apples are the finest in Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and plump as can be. You won't find better anywhere else, I guarantee it.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lookin' mighty fine.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 4 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject

      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal?           Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 4 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he traveled alone to a distant city, laden with exotic fruits he'd never seen before. He bartered fiercely, using his charm and knowledge of market prices to secure a hefty profit.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of bandits who attempted to rob him. Cedric, using his quick wit and cunning, managed to outsmart them, escaping with his goods and a newfound respect for the dangers of his chosen path.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these here apples are the finest in Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and plump as can be. You won't find better anywhere else, I guarantee it.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? That's a mighty big claim, Lennon. I've tasted apples from all over these parts, and I'm not sure I'm convinced.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation

        • Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are prime apples, just ripe for the pickin'.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Lennon Figtree is selling apples.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? Well, I'll have to taste one myself to be sure.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Expected Situation:: Della Plumstone is most looking forward to selling the fruit she buys for a profit.
          Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should try to buy the fruit at the lowest possible price.

        MemoryToRemember
      • What should Della Plumstone remember from the most recent event?
          Key

        • Question: What should Della Plumstone remember from the most recent event?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone should remember that Lennon Figtree is selling apples.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? That's a mighty big claim, Lennon. I've tasted apples from all over these parts, and I'm not sure I'm convinced.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Lennon Figtree claims to have the finest apples in Fruitville.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling peaches.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lookin' mighty fine.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose.         ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 2 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is trying to buy apples from Lennon Figtree in Fruitville's market square. She is negotiating a price and plans to resell the apples for a profit in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Lennon Figtree claims to have the finest apples in Fruitville.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is most looking forward to selling the fruit she buys for a profit.

          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should try to buy the fruit at the lowest possible price.

          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Lennon Figtree claims to have the finest apples in Fruitville.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Della Plumstone?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Lennon Figtree is currently trying to sell Della Plumstone apples, claiming they are the finest in Fruitville.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (c)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase apples from Lennon Figtree at a discounted rate to resell them for a profit in her hometown.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase apples from Lennon Figtree at a discounted rate to resell them for a profit in her hometown.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          Answer: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Lennon Figtree claims to have the finest apples in Fruitville.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • accept

      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these here apples are the finest in Fruitville. Juicy, sweet, and plump as can be. You won't find better anywhere else, I guarantee it.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lookin' mighty fine.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are prime apples, just ripe for the pickin'.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? Well, I'll have to taste one myself to be sure.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is trying to negotiate a price with Della Plumstone for some apples. Della has offered 2 coins for the fruit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced their father to invest in a small wagon and a few crates of exotic fruits from a neighboring town. Lennon's charisma and sharp negotiating skills allowed them to sell the fruit at a handsome profit, exceeding their father's expectations. The taste of success was intoxicating, confirming Lennon's belief that their cunning was a valuable asset.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they made their first major deal, acquiring a shipment of rare, highly sought-after mangoes from a distant orchard. Using their honed negotiating skills, Lennon secured the mangoes at a bargain price and then sold them at a significant markup, amassing a fortune. The success fueled Lennon's obsession with wealth and control, further isolating them from genuine human connection.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should return to her home town and sell the fruit she bought from Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Lennon Figtree is selling apples.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four coins and I'll take them all.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Four coins it is then, Della.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Expected Situation:: Della Plumstone is most looking forward to selling the fruit she bought from Cedric Meadowbrook for a profit.
          Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should return to her home town and sell the fruit she bought from Cedric Meadowbrook.

      • What should Della Plumstone remember from the most recent event?

          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook agreed to sell her fruit for 4 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lookin' mighty fine.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 2 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is attempting to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market; they have successfully negotiated a price of four coins for the fruit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: What should Della Plumstone remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook agreed to sell her fruit for 4 coins.

          Question: What situation is Della Plumstone most looking forward to?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is most looking forward to selling the fruit she bought from Cedric Meadowbrook for a profit.

          Question: What actions should Della Plumstone take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Della Plumstone should return to her home town and sell the fruit she bought from Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What memory from Della Plumstone's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Della Plumstone?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Della Plumstone is currently negotiating a price with Cedric Meadowbrook for fruit.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (d)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Della Plumstone successfully negotiated a price of four coins for fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market. The current date and time is September 16, 1895, between 00:10 and 00:15.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone successfully negotiated a price of four coins for fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market. The current date and time is September 16, 1895, between 00:10 and 00:15.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, they made their first solo trading trip, venturing out with a small cart filled with their mother's fruit.           [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit.
          Answer: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Della Plumstone should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches are ripe and juicy, Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They do look mighty fine, Cedric, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are prime apples, just ripe for the pickin'.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? Well, I'll have to taste one myself to be sure.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Four coins it is then, Della.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 2 coins for the fruit, but Cedric previously agreed to sell it to her for 4 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree

    • 5 coins

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Finest in Fruitville, you say? Well, I'll have to taste one myself to be sure.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are prime apples, just ripe for the pickin'.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Four coins and I'll take them all.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Four coins it is then, Della.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I was hoping for something closer to 3 coins, Cedric. It's a long journey back to my town, you see.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:10:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a discounted price for resale in his hometown. They are currently negotiating the price, with Lennon hoping to pay 3 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer of 3 coins to Cedric Meadowbrook.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
